action.action-desc: Mrs. Houchin introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to require hospitals to provide information on available hospice programs to certain individuals upon discharge under the Medicare program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the End-of-life Access to Supportive and Essential care Act of 2025 or the EASE Act of 2025.

section.header: Requiring hospitals to provide information on available hospice programs to certain individuals upon discharge under the Medicare program

subsection.text: Section 1861(ee)(2)(D) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395x(ee)(2)(D)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting , home health services, after including hospice care;
by striking including the availability of home health services through individuals and entities and inserting the following:

clause.text: in the case of individuals who are likely to need home health services, the availability of such services through home health agencies

paragraph.text: by striking listed by the hospital as available and, in the case of individuals who are likely to need post-hospital extended care services, and inserting the following:

quoted-block.text: listed by the hospital as available;

clause.text: in the case of individuals who are likely to need post-hospital extended care services,

paragraph.text: by striking the period and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following new clause:

clause.text: in the case of individuals who are likely eligible for hospice care, the availability of such care through hospice programs that participate in the program under this title and that serve the area in which the patient resides.

subsection.text: The amendments made by paragraph (1) shall apply with respect to discharges occurring on or after January 1, 2026.
